section.name: Training Material Index
section.p: The OSM Tutorials are provided with the aim of getting you and operational as quickly as possible. The tutorials are loosly related to the DPML products Transit, Magic, Depot, and Metro - each representing a specific concern in Java based component development and application deivery.
The tutorial assumes you have already downloaded and installed Depot and prerequise products (JDK and Ant build system).

tr.td: This tutorial introduces the Transit resource managment system and takes you though examples of how you can improve your code by eliminating resource location and retrival concerns from you development code. The tutorial also present strategies concerning classloader construction, classloader chains, and plugin management solutions. This material will be of particular interest to developers and architects dealing with dynamically adaptive or runtime evolvable systems. This material is to some exent optional as is deals with the a general but low-level concern - however, a quick read through of the introductory page is recommended.

This tutorial focusses on the establishment of a production build environment using technologies that provide transitive dependency management. The tutorial presents the general setup of a build environment, examples of projects representing typical development needs, examples of the use of transitive dependencies in development and the generation of project data and runtime information. Readers planning on getting into component development should go thought this material and personal interested in capturaturing project metrics and related quality assurance concerns could going some interesting milage.

This tutorial is all about the development of components using the IOC (Inversion of Control) principal. The tutorial takes you though the development, testing, and management of component solutions using the DPML Metro component management solution. It presents a series of examples dealing with context driven IOC of simple though to complex composite components and stretegies supporting effective component reuse. Feel free to kick off on this tutorial as it delivers the most value in terms of potential development productivity.

This tutorial is primarily concerned with the management of deployed applications. However, developers will find this material valuable relative to its coverage of configuration management and instalation services. Product support personel will be more interested in Depot managenent aspects and the potential for applying Depot as an application delivery vehicle.
